    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseOptions

        public DatabaseOptions()

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultEngine

        public void setDefaultEngine(DatabaseEngine engine)
        Sets the default database engine that should be used when inserting and creating data.

        Note: It is not recommended that you change this from the default(InnoDB) unless you know what you're doing.

        Parameters:
        engine - a database engine enumeration instance.

      • getEngine

        public DatabaseEngine getEngine()
        Gets the database engine that should be used with INSERT and CREATE statements.
        Returns:
        The database engine that should be used.

      • setQueryTimeout

        public void setQueryTimeout(int queryTimeout)
        Sets the default timeout for all queries in milliseconds, any query that takes longer then the specified time will throw an SQLTimeoutException.

        Note: Setting the query timeout to -1 will use the current database connections default fallback timeout value, which will vary depending on the database type that is being used.

        Parameters:
        queryTimeout - the timeout in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        SQLTimeoutException

      • getQueryTimeout

        public int getQueryTimeout()
        Gets the query timeout length.
        Returns:
        The timeout length.

      • setQueryReturnLimit

        public void setQueryReturnLimit(int queryReturnLimit)
        Sets the query return limit, forcing SELECT statements to not return more than the given amount.

        Note: The executed query will still fetch as many rows as it can, if the returned rows exceeds the return limit it will just cut off any rows that exceeded the limit, because of this it is recommend that you use the SQL LIMIT statement, or something equivalent to it when you want a limited amount of results back.

        Note: Setting the query return limit to -1 will return it to the default settings, of just fetching as much data as it can with no limit, unless one is specified in the query.

        Parameters:
        queryReturnLimit - The amount to limit SELECT statements returned results to.

      • getQueryReturnLimit

        public int getQueryReturnLimit()
        Gets the query return limit.
        Returns:
        The query return limit.

      • enableDebugMessages

        public void enableDebugMessages()
        This will enable the debug mode in the Database Manager, allowing the Database Output to give more detailed information about what is going on within the DBM, internal exceptions will also be printed out to the console.

        Note: There are no reason to enable this on production servers.

      • disableDebugMessages

        public void disableDebugMessages()
        This will disable the debug mode in the Database Manager.

      • isDebugMessagesEnabled

        public boolean isDebugMessagesEnabled()
        Checks to see if the debugging mode is enabled within the DBM.
        Returns:
        true if debugging is enabled, otherwise it will return false.
